A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: When I first saw this film\, my brain was overloaded with thoughts and emotions\, that I couldn't  assess how I truly feel upon first viewing. Once I saw the film the second time\, I thoroughly enjoyed the film. I am still thinking about scenes and themes in The Last Jedi. I can't wait to see the movie again. I think if fans let go of their expectations and enjoy the film as presented\, they could get more enjoyment out of it. I don't understand the whole fan backlash. I read that Rian Johnson\, the director\, got threats on Twitter from fans. Geez\, people  - it's just a movie. No need to threaten people because you think he \"ruined your childhood\". Now I can see why George Lucas bowed out of Star Wars after the Prequels. The fan base can such rabid A-holes.
